name: Walking
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing in the direction you want to walk.
2. Engage your core and balance on two legs, keeping your body upright and your head facing forward.

3. Take a step forward with one foot, keeping the heel of that foot touching the ground while your toes are pointed upwards.

4. As you bring the front foot forward, push off the back foot to transfer your weight onto the front leg.

5. Bring the back foot forward to meet the front foot, and continue walking in this manner.

6. Keep your core engaged and balance on both legs as you walk, engaging your glutes and keeping your posture straight.

7. Continue alternating feet at a natural pace, focusing on maintaining proper form and rhythm throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Walking is a basic exercise that engages the core and legs, burning calories while improving cardiovascular fitness.
